channel.title: Cool trick with powerpoint
channel.description:
Okey, first off what this tutorial teaches is pointless BUT it can "wow" your classmates and teachers. It's more of a little trick which everyone could easly do but you just don't see it :)
[b]The outcome:[/b] The outcome is basicly a loading bar at the beginning of your powerpoint.
[b]Note: Make sure you have a black background on the powerpoint.[/b]
[b]Step one:[/b] Make one retangle and center it. Right click > Format AutoShape and put the colours to this: [img]http://img220.imageshack.us/img220/6163/mmhm1sf7.png[/img]
[b]Step two:[/b] Make a smaller retangle in the one you just made. Right click > Format AutoShape and put the colours to this: [img]http://img220.imageshack.us/img220/6163/mmhm1sf7.png[/img]
[b]Step three:[/b] Right click on the last retangle you made and select 'Custom Animation' and then find wipe. I suggest setting the length time to very slow/slow.
Facts: I'm using Office 2000 ;) I'm not using vista its a theme.

item.title: Cool trick with powerpoint
item.dc:creator: @I_Samn_I I Samn I
item.description:
@I_Samn_I wrote:

Okey, first off what this tutorial teaches is pointless BUT it can “wow” your classmates and teachers. It’s more of a little trick which everyone could easly do but you just don’t see it

The outcome:
The outcome is basicly a loading bar at the beginning of your powerpoint.

Note: Make sure you have a black background on the powerpoint.

Step one:
Make one retangle and center it. Right click > Format AutoShape and put the colours to this:

Step two:
Make a smaller retangle in the one you just made. Right click > Format AutoShape and put the colours to this:

Step three:
Right click on the last retangle you made and select ‘Custom Animation’ and then find wipe.
I suggest setting the length time to very slow/slow.

Facts:
I’m using Office 2000
I’m not using vista its a theme.

Read full topic
